thread.title: DiCaprio, Paramount option Volkswagen scandal book proposal
thread.title_full: DiCaprio, Paramount option Volkswagen scandal book proposal

title: DiCaprio, Paramount option Volkswagen scandal book proposal
text:
Updated: 5:38 p.m. Monday, Oct. 12, 2015 | Posted: 5:38 p.m. Monday, Oct. 12, 2015 DiCaprio, Paramount option Volkswagen scandal book proposal ﻿ The Associated Press LOS ANGELES — 
The Volkswagen clean diesel emissions scandal is still chugging along, but Hollywood already has its eyes on a possible movie about the ordeal. 
Paramount Pictures and Leonardo DiCaprio's production company Appian Way have optioned the rights to a book proposal from New York Times journalist Jack Ewing about the ongoing debacle. 
The German automaker admitted last month that 11 million of its vehicles worldwide were fitted with cheating software to beat emission tests. VW chief Martin Winterkorn resigned after the scandal broke in the U.S., saying he was not aware of any wrongdoing on his part. 
Ewing's still-untitled book will explore the "more, better, faster" ethos and how it played into the scandal. 
DiCaprio, an active environmentalist, would serve as a producer on the project. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our FOX23 News This Morning Newsletter Sign Up
